page.title: 07Egypt & The Walls of Jericho
page.content: Our square was mainly rural and the land was used for grazing stock animals and haymaking. The only amenities were a public house and a motor engineering garage. The only buildings were a few farms and the occasional bungalow,but at Egypt there was a row of old cottages. In conversation with a few of the inhabitants we discovered that there was no bus route and they had to pay to hire a private school bus.They had no postal conveniencies or any shops. The nearest shops were about one mile away. None of the houses were supplied with a main drainage system.It was a very good local community and many of the locals often went to the pub.They said that you needed transport to get anywhere if you lived up there.
